Key Match Events: The Astros failed to bring home the go-ahead run in the 10th and 11th innings
The A's bunted their runner home in the 12th, plating two runs on three consecutive bunts
The Astros got one back in their half of the 12th, but left the tying run on third with one out
Post-Match Reflections: It's unclear why Houston keeps falling short in extra innings, especially for a team that prioritizes batting average and limits strikeouts.
The Astros didn't deserve to win, not after leaving 13 men on base and going 2-for-17 with runners in scoring position
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros have a losing record in extra-innings games in four of five seasons since the 'ghost runner' rule was introduced in 2020.
The Astros are just 6-18 in extras following their latest debacle against the Oakland Athletics on Tuesday.
The Astros started 24-30 through 54 games this year, and look where they are now.
Others: Spencer Arrighetti pitched into the seventh, finishing with seven strikeouts and a quality start in a nice rebound performance from his previous outing.
The Astros didn't score until the bottom of the seventh, finally breaking through on Jon Singleton's RBI triple and Jose Altuve's RBI single.
